extendedIngredients.name: almond butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup almond butter (or any nut/seed butter)

extendedIngredients.name: almond milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¾ cup unsweetened vanilla almond milk

extendedIngredients.name: dates
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup dates (about 100g or 6 large Medjool dates)*

extendedIngredients.name: vanilla protein powder
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup chocolate or vanilla protein powder

recipes.title: soft and chewy chocolate brownie protein bars
recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 350F and prepare an 8x8 baking dish by lining it with a sheet of aluminum foil or parchment paper, leaving a few inches of overhang on the sides to allow for easy removal. Spray foil with cooking spray and set aside.Add almond butter, dates, almond milk, and vanilla to the bowl of a food processor or blender, and process until smooth and well-combined. Add protein powder, cocoa, and salt, and continue processing until all ingredients are fully incorporated. Finally, add oats and pulse until just combined. You don't want them to break down too much. Stir in chocolate chips by hand.Transfer dough to the prepared baking pan, and use a spatula or your hands to spread the mixture evenly in the pan.Bake for 15, until edges and top have set. Remove from oven and let cool in pan before cutting into bars using a sharp knife. Store in an airtight container for up to a week, or in the fridge for

steps.step: Preheat oven to 350F and prepare an 8x8 baking dish by lining it with a sheet of aluminum foil or parchment paper, leaving a few inches of overhang on the sides to allow for easy removal. Spray foil with cooking spray and set aside.
Add almond butter, dates, almond milk, and vanilla to the bowl of a food processor or blender, and process until smooth and well-combined.

Add protein powder, cocoa, and salt, and continue processing until all ingredients are fully incorporated. Finally, add oats and pulse until just combined. You don't want them to break down too much. Stir in chocolate chips by hand.
Transfer dough to the prepared baking pan, and use a spatula or your hands to spread the mixture evenly in the pan.
Bake for 15, until edges and top have set.
Remove from oven and let cool in pan before cutting into bars using a sharp knife. Store in an airtight container for up to a week, or in the fridge for
